results.title: The Devil
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: Happily married artist is tempted by beautiful model. The Devil delights in making matters worse. Cast includes Arthur V. johnson, George Gebhardt, Harold Salter, Florence Lawrence, Mack Sennett. Silent film with no intertitles.

results.title: The Development of transportation
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Electrical Research Products and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: A study of the development of transportation in the USA during the past 150 years. The spread of railway and highway networks over the geographical barriers of the continent, and the principle stages of the development of the locomotive and automobile engines are dealt within detail; air transport, and its potentialities form the final part of this survey.

results.title: The Development of instruments and their music: a symphony is recorded
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Shows the rehearsal and performance of C.P.E. Bach’s Symphony in D by the Croyland Chamber Orchestra, as it was recorded for the Open University gramophone record “The Rise of the Symphony.” Examines the steps taken to achieve a musically authoritative recording of an 18th century orchestral work.

results.title: The Development of communication
results.brief_description: Inventions are a social phenomena, although the influence of one person always tends to make them seem the result of a miraculous individual effort. This film shows the social conditions which gave rise to the invention of the battery, the ground connection, the electro-magnet, the telephone, telegraph, cable, and radio, thus making possible much more rapid and reliable communication services than had been possible in the pre-electric age. These more rapid communications were essential if industrialisation was to develop and expand.

results.title: The Detour
results.creator_credit: Shelby Leverington, Caroline Mouris and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: A film experienced entirely from the point of view of an elderly patient dying in a large hospital. As modern medicine struggles to keep eighty three year old Catherine Hamilton alive she struggles just as hard to die in peace. Each time she thinks she may be able to slip away, the doctors and nurses bring her back with a wonder drug, or a new machine. But Catherine continues to fight to control her own destiny with humour and dignity

results.title: The Desperate heart
results.brief_description: A modern dance solo based on a poem by John Malcolm Brinner describing the loneliness and agony resulting from the loss of a lover. A variety of camera effects and double exposures, combined with the dancing and reading by Valerie Bettis, produces an interesting experiment in modern dance film. Created, spoken and performed by Valerie Bettis; original music by Bernando Segall.

results.title: The Desert fox
results.creator_credit: Stephen Hills, Dennis Tupicoff and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: July, 1942, war veterans recall the best fighting animal of the era, and a great mate - the desert fox (who looks remarkably like Rommel), captured in a visual array of claymation, stop frame and animation in this war mockumentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Hills, Dennis Tupicoff and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television

results.title: The Desert
results.creator_credit: Michael Birch and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Introduces the desert biome; its geographical locations, the causes of its formation, its temperature conditions and consequent aridity; its dust storms, and its rains. Shows the diversity of the plants and animals of the desert and how they adapt to their arid environment.

results.title: The Descent
results.creator_credit: Andrew Schultz, John Bird, David Atkinson, Film Victoria and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A claymation (influenced by Jan Svankmejer in sepia tones and use of stop-still animated found objects and cut-tin figurines) depicts a storm ravaged landscape of an empire. The ruling giant, ‘metal’ Queen summons her miniature servants to find and rescue her giant clay King. Like ants the small servants work together to unite the King and Queen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew Schultz, John Bird, David Atkinson, Film Victoria and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School

results.title: The Dermis probe
results.creator_credit: Institute of Comparative Dermatography and Richard Williams Films
results.brief_description: Philosophical, scientific voices intone the marvels beyond man’s comprehension, to the accompaniment of dreamy, highly coloured images and sounds. Until, finally the camera pulls back to reveal the subject of the symposium. This parody of the jargon and the relentless close-ups of didactic scientific films is actually a parable of an 800 year old story: “Elephant in the Dark” a little fable about people who feel different parts of an elephant, all believing that what they feel is the whole beast. A serious yet entertaining look at the impediments in current thought which prevent certain forms of understanding between people. Written by Idries Shah
